intro: Barleria elegans, commonly known as the silverleaf barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of pink or purple, which bloom from spring to early summer. Barleria elegans is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy flowers.
